step

public void step(sim.engine.SimState state)
Specified by:
step in interface sim.engine.Steppable
Overrides:
step in class Agent

findAndConsumeIdeal

protected void findAndConsumeIdeal()
Find the lowest cost suppliers for all goods for which this consumer has a positive willingness to pay, one unit for each natural person represented by this consumer agent (for each and every good), as long as the price is less than their willingness to pay.

allDesiredGoods

public java.util.List<Good> allDesiredGoods()
Returns:
A list of all goods for which this consumer currently has a non-zero willingness to pay.

findAndConsumeIdeal

protected void findAndConsumeIdeal(double qty)
Find the lowest cost suppliers for all goods for which this consumer has a positive willingness to pay, up to the specified quantity (for each and every good), as long as the price is less than their willingness to pay.

findAndConsumeIdeal

protected void findAndConsumeIdeal(Good g)
Find the lowest cost suppliers for the spcified good and consume one unit from them for each natural person represented by this consumer agent as long as the price is less than their willingness to pay.

Parameters:
g -

getSortedOffers

protected java.util.List<Offer> getSortedOffers(Good g)
Parameters:
g -
Returns:
a list of the available offers for the specified good, in the markets in which this consumer participates, sorted by lowest price first.

findAndConsumeIdeal

protected void findAndConsumeIdeal(Good g,
                                   double qtyToConsume)

consumeOrderedOffers

protected void consumeOrderedOffers(java.util.List<Offer> offers,
                                    double qtyToConsume)
Consume from the specified list of offers, in order, until the specified quantity has been consumed or the offer price is greater than the consumer's willingness to pay.

Parameters:
offers - An ordered list of offers to purchase from.

enterMarket

public void enterMarket(Market m)
Enter the specified market as a consumer. The market becomes known to the Consumer agent through Map Consumer.markets>

Parameters:
m -

actualize

public void actualize(SaleOfGoods saleOfGoods)
Actualize the specified SaleOfGoods transaction. The default implementation simply tracks the amount spent, the quantity of goods purchased, and the consumer suplus. It assumes willingness to pay is constant (i.e., one unit of the good for each natural person represented by this consumer agent).

Parameters:
saleOfGoods -

actualize

public void actualize(MarketEntry marketEntry)
Updates Consumer.markets, indicating that the consumer has access to the specified market.

Parameters:
marketEntry -

getPopulation

public double getPopulation()
Returns:
The number of persons represented by this consumer agent.

getTotalSurplus

public double getTotalSurplus()
Returns:
The total consumer surplus for all goods for all periods.

getPastSurplus

Parameters:
stepsAgo -
Returns:
The amount of surplus in the specified past period for all goods;

getWTP

public double getWTP(Good good)
Query the amount that persons represented by this consumer agent are willing to pay for the specified good. In the default implementation, if no value has been previously set, this function will return 0.0.

Parameters:
good - Which good to value
Returns:
The amount this consumer agent is willing to pay for the good in question.

setWTP

public void setWTP(Good good,
                   double price)
Set the amount that persons represented by this consumer agent are willing to pay for the specified good. If a subclass overrides the getWTP() function (e.g., to dynamically calculate WTP or something...) then this value may be ignored.

Parameters:
good -
price -

getTotalSurplus

public double getTotalSurplus(Good g)
Parameters:
g -
Returns:
The total consumer surplus from the specified good.

addMarket

private void addMarket(Good g,
                       Market m)
When entering new markets, make sure there is a non-null Set so that the market can be added. If there is not yet a non-null WTP for this good, initialize it and set it to zero.

update

public void update()
Description copied from interface: AsyncUpdate
Commit the changes made to this object to the underlying data structure. For example, if the implementing object is a hash map, it should apply all the changes it has saved and deferred to the backing HashMap.

Specified by:
update in interface AsyncUpdate
